Sentencas: Thermodynamics of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production has been studied by Gibbs free energy minimization method.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production

Sentencas: The optimum conditions for hydrogen production are identified: reaction temperatures between 1000 and 1100 K and oxygen-to-glycerol molar ratios of 0.4-0.6 at 1 atm.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production

Sentencas: Under the optimal conditions, complete conversion of glycerol, 78.93%-87.31% yield of hydrogen and 75.12%-87.97% yield of carbon monoxide could be achieved in the absence of carbon formation.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production

Sentencas: The glycerol partial oxidation with O-2 is suitable for providing hydrogen-rich fuels for Molten Carbonate Fuel Cell and Solid Oxide Fuel Cell.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production

Sentencas: The carbon-formed and carbon-free regions are found, which are useful in guiding the search for suitable catalysts for the reaction.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production

Sentencas: Inert gases have a positive effect on the hydrogen and carbon monoxide yields.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of glycerol partial oxidation for hydrogen production
